TopicTitle: Does your rocket vibrate for no reason?

Articles.Content:
Just wanted to post a short tip. If your rocket is ever vibrating from launch to landing, shaking even, the reason is because somewhere there is a part clipped. Examine your rocket closely and you'll find it.

Just wanted to point this out because I spent 45 minutes on a clipped decoupler just now ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
In particular, the Service Bays cause problems if anything is clipped in/near their doors.

> 
> In particular, the Service Bays cause problems if anything is clipped in/near their doors.

Yup, modded thin decouplers + service bay = a rockin good time!

Also, if you put a probe core inside a service bay, always mount it on the floor (or on something else mounted on the floor). Never hang the probe core from the ceiling or you get bad shakes ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Oh, dam, that's why my small probes are so nuts, there's no way to get RCS on them at my tech level without some clipping.

Worth noting, I've had these issues with service bays, but I've found that if you open and close the service bay the shaking parts inside will reseat themselves and then stop causing problems until you focus on another craft and or go to the Space Center.

No idea why.
